title: Precise CC-AP vs CC-PH Gap Characterization
main_result: Gap = {P : log N < alternation_depth(P) <= poly N}
significance: Quantitative separation impossible in classical complexity!

summary.main_result: Gap = {P : log N < alternation(P) <= poly N}
summary.classical_comparison: PH vs PSPACE unknown; CC-PH vs CC-AP SOLVED

new_questions.question: What is the exact constant C in k* = C * log N?
new_questions.notes: Depends on consensus protocol; could be characterized precisely

new_questions.question: Are there natural problems at each gap level?
new_questions.notes: COORD-GAME_k is artificial; are there naturally-occurring problems?

new_questions.question: What is the gap under different fault models?
new_questions.notes: Crash-failure might have different k*; gap might change

new_questions.question: Can the gap be characterized algebraically?
new_questions.notes: Connect to liftability theory from earlier phases

new_questions.question: Is there structure within the gap levels?
new_questions.notes: Are some gap levels 'harder' than others beyond alternation count?
